alert.note: Alert for Kent; Queen Anne's (Maryland) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 14 at 7:19AM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of central Queen Anne`s and Kent Counties through 745 AM EDT... At 719 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Newtown to Magothy River to Rhode River. Movement was east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Chestertown, Romancoke, Rock Hall, Betterton, Old Town, Stevensville, Langford, Chester, Newtown, Overton, Morgnec, Kennedyville, Stevensville South and Kingstown. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
